title: How many children do Ryan Reynolds and Blake Lively have?
text:
Ryan Reynolds with his wife and new baby (Picture: @VancityReynolds)

Sound the alarm – Ryan Reynolds has shared a picture of his new daughter in a tweet which encourages Canadian voters to consider climate change when they vote in the upcoming federal elections

The photo shows him holding her as he smiles at his wife and fellow actor Blake Lively.

In the picture, the baby’s face is covered with a photoshop smiley face.

The tweet from Ryan reads: ‘I want my daughters to experience the same natural playground I grew up in.’

Ryan and Blake with daughters James Reynolds and Ines Reynolds at the ceremony honouring Ryan Reynolds with a Star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame in 2016 (Picture: Axelle/Bauer-Griffin/FilmMagic)

How many children do Ryan Reynolds and Blake Lively have?

Ryan, 42, and Blake, 32, have three daughters.

James, four, was born in December 2014, and Inez, three, was born in September 2015.

Ryan and Blake reportedly welcomed their third baby ‘two months ago’.

The couple first started dating in 2011, after meeting the year before on the set of Green Lantern, in which they both starred.

They married less than a year later in 2012.

Ryan and Blake at the premiere of ‘Pokemon Detective Pikachu’ (Picture: ANGELA WEISS/AFP/Getty Images)

Blake confirmed that she was pregnant with their third child when she appeared with Ryan at the premiere for Pokemon Detective Pikachu in May.

Ryan previously joked that he had been telling their youngest to ‘stay in’ Blake’s womb.

When Ryan shared a collection of photographs for his wife’s birthday this year, the first image included Blake’s baby bump.

One fan commented ‘Get that baby outta there!!!’ to which Ryan replied ‘I keep whispering, “stay in…”‘

Blake recently opened up on parenting, telling People: ‘I think it’s hard to slap labels on any parents because it’s just so tricky.

‘It’s like every moment you’re figuring out what the heck you’re doing. You think, “Ooh, should I be more strict, or should I be more I don’t know, emotional?” Or whatever it is.

‘If anybody knows how to be a parent, I feel like grandparents really know how to be parents. But parents, you just figure it out as you go. So, I wouldn’t put a label on it.’
